GetDevice.name: GetDevice
GetDevice.documentation:
Retrieves the devices available in Amazon Braket.

For backwards compatibility with older versions of BraketSchemas, OpenQASM information is omitted from GetDevice API calls. To get this information the user-agent needs to present a recent version of the BraketSchemas (1.8.0 or later). The Braket SDK automatically reports this for you. If you do not see OpenQASM results in the GetDevice response when using a Braket SDK, you may need to set AWS_EXECUTION_ENV environment variable to configure user-agent. See the code examples provided below for how to do this for the AWS CLI, Boto3, and the Go, Java, and JavaScript/TypeScript SDKs.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation: Shows the tags associated with this resource.

SearchDevices.name: SearchDevices
SearchDevices.documentation: Searches for devices using the specified filters.

SearchJobs.name: SearchJobs
SearchJobs.documentation: Searches for Amazon Braket jobs that match the specified filter values.

SearchQuantumTasks.name: SearchQuantumTasks
SearchQuantumTasks.documentation: Searches for tasks that match the specified filter values.

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.documentation: Add a tag to the specified resource.

AccessDeniedException.documentation: You do not have sufficient access to perform this action.

containerImage.documentation: The container image used to create an Amazon Braket job.

scriptModeConfig.documentation: Configures the paths to the Python scripts used for entry and training.

AlgorithmSpecification.documentation: Defines the Amazon Braket job to be created. Specifies the container image the job uses and the paths to the Python scripts used for entry and training.

type.documentation: The association type for the specified Amazon Braket resource arn.

Association.documentation: The Amazon Braket resource and the association type.

jobArn.documentation: The ARN of the Amazon Braket job to cancel.

cancellationStatus.documentation: The status of the job cancellation request.

jobArn.documentation: The ARN of the Amazon Braket job.

clientToken.documentation: The client token associated with the request.

quantumTaskArn.documentation: The ARN of the task to cancel.

ConflictException.documentation: An error occurred due to a conflict.

ContainerImage.documentation: The container image used to create an Amazon Braket job.

algorithmSpecification.documentation: Definition of the Amazon Braket job to be created. Specifies the container image the job uses and information about the Python scripts used for entry and training.

associations.documentation: The list of Amazon Braket resources associated with the hybrid job.

checkpointConfig.documentation: Information about the output locations for job checkpoint data.

clientToken.documentation: A unique token that guarantees that the call to this API is idempotent.

deviceConfig.documentation: The quantum processing unit (QPU) or simulator used to create an Amazon Braket job.

hyperParameters.documentation: Algorithm-specific parameters used by an Amazon Braket job that influence the quality of the training job. The values are set with a string of JSON key:value pairs, where the key is the name of the hyperparameter and the value is the value of th hyperparameter.

inputDataConfig.documentation: A list of parameters that specify the name and type of input data and where it is located.

instanceConfig.documentation: Configuration of the resource instances to use while running the hybrid job on Amazon Braket.

jobName.documentation: The name of the Amazon Braket job.

outputDataConfig.documentation: The path to the S3 location where you want to store job artifacts and the encryption key used to store them.

roleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that Amazon Braket can assume to perform tasks on behalf of a user. It can access user resources, run an Amazon Braket job container on behalf of user, and output resources to the users' s3 buckets.

stoppingCondition.documentation: The user-defined criteria that specifies when a job stops running.

tags.documentation: A tag object that consists of a key and an optional value, used to manage metadata for Amazon Braket resources.

jobArn.documentation: The ARN of the Amazon Braket job created.

associations.documentation: The list of Amazon Braket resources associated with the quantum task.

clientToken.documentation: The client token associated with the request.

deviceArn.documentation: The ARN of the device to run the task on.

deviceParameters.documentation: The parameters for the device to run the task on.

jobToken.documentation: The token for an Amazon Braket job that associates it with the quantum task.

outputS3Bucket.documentation: The S3 bucket to store task result files in.

outputS3KeyPrefix.documentation: The key prefix for the location in the S3 bucket to store task results in.

shots.documentation: The number of shots to use for the task.

tags.documentation: Tags to be added to the quantum task you're creating.

quantumTaskArn.documentation: The ARN of the task created by the request.

s3DataSource.documentation: Information about the data stored in Amazon S3 used by the Amazon Braket job.

DataSource.documentation: Information about the source of the data used by the Amazon Braket job.

device.documentation: The primary quantum processing unit (QPU) or simulator used to create and run an Amazon Braket job.

DeviceConfig.documentation: Configures the quantum processing units (QPUs) or simulator used to create and run an Amazon Braket job.

queuePriority.documentation: Optional. Specifies the priority of the queue. Tasks in a priority queue are processed before the tasks in a normal queue.

queueSize.documentation: The number of jobs or tasks in the queue for a given device.

DeviceQueueInfo.documentation: Information about tasks and jobs queued on a device.

deviceArn.documentation: The ARN of the device to retrieve.

deviceCapabilities.documentation: Details about the capabilities of the device.

deviceQueueInfo.documentation: List of information about tasks and jobs queued on a device.

providerName.documentation: The name of the partner company for the device.

additionalAttributeNames.documentation: A list of attributes to return information for.

jobArn.documentation: The ARN of the job to retrieve.

algorithmSpecification.documentation: Definition of the Amazon Braket job created. Specifies the container image the job uses, information about the Python scripts used for entry and training, and the user-defined metrics used to evaluation the job.

associations.documentation: The list of Amazon Braket resources associated with the hybrid job.

billableDuration.documentation: The billable time the Amazon Braket job used to complete.

checkpointConfig.documentation: Information about the output locations for job checkpoint data.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time that the Amazon Braket job was created.

deviceConfig.documentation: The quantum processing unit (QPU) or simulator used to run the Amazon Braket job.

endedAt.documentation: The date and time that the Amazon Braket job ended.

events.documentation: Details about the type and time events occurred related to the Amazon Braket job.

failureReason.documentation: A description of the reason why an Amazon Braket job failed, if it failed.

hyperParameters.documentation: Algorithm-specific parameters used by an Amazon Braket job that influence the quality of the traiing job. The values are set with a string of JSON key:value pairs, where the key is the name of the hyperparameter and the value is the value of th hyperparameter.

inputDataConfig.documentation: A list of parameters that specify the name and type of input data and where it is located.

instanceConfig.documentation: The resource instances to use while running the hybrid job on Amazon Braket.

jobArn.documentation: The ARN of the Amazon Braket job.

jobName.documentation: The name of the Amazon Braket job.

outputDataConfig.documentation: The path to the S3 location where job artifacts are stored and the encryption key used to store them there.

queueInfo.documentation: Queue information for the requested job. Only returned if QueueInfo is specified in the additionalAttributeNames" field in the GetJob API request.

roleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that Amazon Braket can assume to perform tasks on behalf of a user. It can access user resources, run an Amazon Braket job container on behalf of user, and output resources to the s3 buckets of a user.

startedAt.documentation: The date and time that the Amazon Braket job was started.

status.documentation: The status of the Amazon Braket job.

stoppingCondition.documentation: The user-defined criteria that specifies when to stop a job running.

tags.documentation: A tag object that consists of a key and an optional value, used to manage metadata for Amazon Braket resources.

additionalAttributeNames.documentation: A list of attributes to return information for.

quantumTaskArn.documentation: The ARN of the task to retrieve.

associations.documentation: The list of Amazon Braket resources associated with the quantum task.

createdAt.documentation: The time at which the task was created.

deviceArn.documentation: The ARN of the device the task was run on.

deviceParameters.documentation: The parameters for the device on which the task ran.

endedAt.documentation: The time at which the task ended.

jobArn.documentation: The ARN of the Amazon Braket job associated with the quantum task.

outputS3Bucket.documentation: The S3 bucket where task results are stored.

outputS3Directory.documentation: The folder in the S3 bucket where task results are stored.

queueInfo.documentation: Queue information for the requested quantum task. Only returned if QueueInfo is specified in the additionalAttributeNames" field in the GetQuantumTask API request.

shots.documentation: The number of shots used in the task.

tags.documentation: The tags that belong to this task.

message.documentation: Optional. Provides more information about the queue position. For example, if the job is complete and no longer in the queue, the message field contains that information.

position.documentation: Current position of the job in the jobs queue.

HybridJobQueueInfo.documentation: Information about the queue for a specified job.

channelName.documentation: A named input source that an Amazon Braket job can consume.

InputFileConfig.documentation: A list of parameters that specify the input channels, type of input data, and where it is located.

instanceCount.documentation: Configures the number of resource instances to use while running an Amazon Braket job on Amazon Braket. The default value is 1.

instanceType.documentation: Configures the type resource instances to use while running an Amazon Braket hybrid job.

volumeSizeInGb.documentation: The size of the storage volume, in GB, that user wants to provision.

InstanceConfig.documentation: Configures the resource instances to use while running the Amazon Braket hybrid job on Amazon Braket.

InternalServiceException.documentation: The request processing has failed because of an unknown error, exception, or failure.

localPath.documentation: (Optional) The local directory where checkpoints are written. The default directory is /opt/braket/checkpoints/.

s3Uri.documentation: Identifies the S3 path where you want Amazon Braket to store checkpoints. For example, s3://bucket-name/key-name-prefix.

JobCheckpointConfig.documentation: Contains information about the output locations for job checkpoint data.

eventType.documentation: The type of event that occurred related to the Amazon Braket job.

message.documentation: A message describing the event that occurred related to the Amazon Braket job.

timeOfEvent.documentation: The type of event that occurred related to the Amazon Braket job.

JobEventDetails.documentation: Details about the type and time events occurred related to the Amazon Braket job.

kmsKeyId.documentation: The AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key that Amazon Braket uses to encrypt the job training artifacts at rest using Amazon S3 server-side encryption.

s3Path.documentation: Identifies the S3 path where you want Amazon Braket to store the job training artifacts. For example, s3://bucket-name/key-name-prefix.

JobOutputDataConfig.documentation: Specifies the path to the S3 location where you want to store job artifacts and the encryption key used to store them.

maxRuntimeInSeconds.documentation: The maximum length of time, in seconds, that an Amazon Braket job can run.

JobStoppingCondition.documentation: Specifies limits for how long an Amazon Braket job can run.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time that the Amazon Braket job was created.

device.documentation: Provides summary information about the primary device used by an Amazon Braket job.

endedAt.documentation: The date and time that the Amazon Braket job ended.

jobArn.documentation: The ARN of the Amazon Braket job.

jobName.documentation: The name of the Amazon Braket job.

startedAt.documentation: The date and time that the Amazon Braket job was started.

status.documentation: The status of the Amazon Braket job.

tags.documentation: A tag object that consists of a key and an optional value, used to manage metadata for Amazon Braket resources.

JobSummary.documentation: Provides summary information about an Amazon Braket job.

resourceArn.documentation: Specify the resourceArn for the resource whose tags to display.

tags.documentation: Displays the key, value pairs of tags associated with this resource.

message.documentation: Optional. Provides more information about the queue position. For example, if the task is complete and no longer in the queue, the message field contains that information.

position.documentation: Current position of the task in the quantum tasks queue.

queuePriority.documentation: Optional. Specifies the priority of the queue. Quantum tasks in a priority queue are processed before the tasks in a normal queue.

QuantumTaskQueueInfo.documentation: Information about the queue for the specified quantum task.

createdAt.documentation: The time at which the task was created.

deviceArn.documentation: The ARN of the device the task ran on.

endedAt.documentation: The time at which the task finished.

outputS3Bucket.documentation: The S3 bucket where the task result file is stored..

outputS3Directory.documentation: The folder in the S3 bucket where the task result file is stored.

tags.documentation: Displays the key, value pairs of tags associated with this quantum task.

s3Uri.documentation: Depending on the value specified for the S3DataType, identifies either a key name prefix or a manifest that locates the S3 data source.

S3DataSource.documentation: Information about the data stored in Amazon S3 used by the Amazon Braket job.

compressionType.documentation: The type of compression used by the Python scripts for an Amazon Braket job.

entryPoint.documentation: The path to the Python script that serves as the entry point for an Amazon Braket job.

s3Uri.documentation: The URI that specifies the S3 path to the Python script module that contains the training script used by an Amazon Braket job.

ScriptModeConfig.documentation: Contains information about the Python scripts used for entry and by an Amazon Braket job.

name.documentation: The name to use to filter results.

values.documentation: The values to use to filter results.

SearchDevicesFilter.documentation: The filter to use for searching devices.

filters.documentation: The filter values to use to search for a device.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in the response.

nextToken.documentation: A token used for pagination of results returned in the response. Use the token returned from the previous request continue results where the previous request ended.

devices.documentation: An array of DeviceSummary objects for devices that match the specified filter values.

nextToken.documentation: A token used for pagination of results, or null if there are no additional results. Use the token value in a subsequent request to continue results where the previous request ended.

name.documentation: The name to use for the jobs filter.

operator.documentation: An operator to use for the jobs filter.

values.documentation: The values to use for the jobs filter.

SearchJobsFilter.documentation: A filter used to search for Amazon Braket jobs.

filters.documentation: The filter values to use when searching for a job.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in the response.

nextToken.documentation: A token used for pagination of results returned in the response. Use the token returned from the previous request to continue results where the previous request ended.

jobs.documentation: An array of JobSummary objects for devices that match the specified filter values.

nextToken.documentation: A token used for pagination of results, or null if there are no additional results. Use the token value in a subsequent request to continue results where the previous request ended.

name.documentation: The name of the device used for the task.

operator.documentation: An operator to use in the filter.

values.documentation: The values to use for the filter.

SearchQuantumTasksFilter.documentation: A filter to use to search for tasks.

maxResults.documentation: Maximum number of results to return in the response.

nextToken.documentation: A token used for pagination of results returned in the response. Use the token returned from the previous request continue results where the previous request ended.
A token used for pagination of results, or null if there are no additional results. Use the token value in a subsequent request to continue results where the previous request ended.

quantumTasks.documentation: An array of QuantumTaskSummary objects for tasks that match the specified filters.

ServiceQuotaExceededException.documentation: The request failed because a service quota is exceeded.

resourceArn.documentation: Specify the resourceArn of the resource to which a tag will be added.

tags.documentation: Specify the tags to add to the resource.

resourceArn.documentation: Specify the resourceArn for the resource from which to remove the tags.

tagKeys.documentation: Specify the keys for the tags to remove from the resource.

ValidationException.documentation: The input fails to satisfy the constraints specified by an AWS service.

documentation:
The Amazon Braket API Reference provides information about the operations and structures supported in Amazon Braket.

Additional Resources:

  • Amazon Braket Developer Guide
